argument.description: An expression that returns a value of any built-in numeric data type.
An expression that returns a value of any built-in numeric data type.
An expression that returns a value of any built-in numeric data type.

description: The NORMALIZE_DECFLOAT function returns a decimal floating-point value equal to the input argument set to its simplest form; that is, a nonzero number with trailing zeros in the coefficient has those zeros removed.
sample:
NORMALIZE_DECFLOAT(DECFLOAT(2.1)) = 2.1
NORMALIZE_DECFLOAT(DECFLOAT(-2.0)) = -2
NORMALIZE_DECFLOAT(DECFLOAT(1.200)) = 1.2
NORMALIZE_DECFLOAT(DECFLOAT(-120)) = -1.2E+2
NORMALIZE_DECFLOAT(DECFLOAT(120.00)) = 1.2E+2
NORMALIZE_DECFLOAT(DECFLOAT(0.00)) = 0
NORMALIZE_DECFLOAT(-NAN) = -NaN 
NORMALIZE_DECFLOAT(-INFINITY) = -Infinity
